content: Ah, got it. Thanks for clarifying. It's great that you have a clear motivation and direction for your studies. Are there any aspects of technology or programming that particularly interest you?
Hello again! Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Not really. Can you give me history of technology?

Sure thing, here's a quick rundown: the earliest forms of technology date back to prehistoric times, with the invention of simple tools made from stone, wood and bone. Later on, the development of agriculture and the wheel helped to propel civilization forward. Fast forward to the industrial revolution, which saw the invention of the steam engine, and later, the harnessing of electricity, both of which further advanced technology. In the 20th century, we saw the development of computers, the internet, and various other technologies, leading us to where we are today.
That's nice to hear. Can you tell me more about... No, just tell me a little story.

Once upon a time, there was a little robot named Bleep who loved to tinker with machines. One day, she decided to create a robot friend of her own, so she gathered up scrap metal, circuit boards, and various other parts. After weeks of hard work, she finally brought her creation to life. Her new robot friend, named Boop, shared Bleep's love of tinkering and together, they continued to invent and explore the world of technology. And they lived happily ever after (or at least, until Bleep's batteries ran out). The end.
